materials.raw_text: P: 10 g, Sc: 12 g, Si: 15 g, Tb: 6 g, Y: 2 g

sourcing.instructions: P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supplier; Sc (Scandium) - Rare earth metals supplier; Si (Silicon) - Electronics store; Tb (Terbium) - Rare earth metals supplier; Y (Yttrium) - Rare earth metals supplier.
steps: P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supplier; Sc (Scandium) - Rare earth metals supplier; Si (Silicon) - Electronics store; Tb (Terbium) - Rare earth metals supplier; Y (Yttrium) - Rare earth metals supplier.
1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine P, Sc, Si, Tb, and Y. 3. Mix thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer until homogenous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine P, Sc, Si, Tb, and Y. 3. Mix thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer until homogenous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a crucible. 2. Place crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C (2192°F) for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a crucible. 2. Place crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat to 1200°C (2192°F) for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of components.

steps: 1. Gradually reduce temperature to 600°C (1112°F) over 1 hour. 2. Turn off furnace and allow crucible to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours).
cooling.raw_text: 1. Gradually reduce temperature to 600°C (1112°F) over 1 hour. 2. Turn off furnace and allow crucible to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours).

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond blade saw to cut the sample into desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges to smooth finishes. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond blade saw to cut the sample into desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges to smooth finishes. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability.
